intro: Elatostema petiolatum, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. Elatostema petiolatum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
